item.title: How to make a object open up a bank?
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

Yep, just make sure it’s 1. Clickable, and 2. Make sure there isn’t already a case like it, so they don’t conflict. And you’re good to go.[br][size=1]Posted on: February 26, 2007, 01:11:35 PM[/size][hr]it work?

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a object open up a bank?
item.dc:creator: @junkyNL junkyNL
item.description:
@junkyNL wrote:

   case 168:
	openUpBank();
	break;

so if i wanna have this object 2995 open bank i need to make

   case 2995:
	openUpBank();
	break;

is that good?

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a object open up a bank?

item.title: How to make a object open up a bank?
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

Search your client.java for the cases… then look the object ID of the item you want to open your bank. if it’s not in there. create a new case for the object’s id

Lets say a bankbooth’s id was 168. You’d make a case that looks like this, if there isn’t one.

case 168: openUpBank(); break;

Read full topic
